text: is a Japanese city in Kōchi Prefecture on the Pacific coastline of the island of Shikoku.Auzias, Dominique and Jean-Paul Labourdette. (2009). Petit Futé Japon: Bienvenue au pays du Soleil-Levant, p. 444; excerpt, Le port de shimizu est situé à 20 km du cap Ashizuri-misaki, ses maisons entourent et protègent un port naturel; retrieved 2013-2-25. ==History== The village of Nakanohama in what is now Tosashimizu was the birthplace of Nakahama Manjirō, who was the first known Japanese to live in the United States in the mid-19th century.Lade, Jennifer. "Manjiro Festival celebrates sister cities of Fairhaven, Tosashimizu," South Coast (Massachusetts). October 4, 2009; retrieved 2013-2-25. The modern city was established in 1954. ==Sister cities== * New Bedford, Massachusetts, US*Medeiros, Michael. "Preserving the Manjirō Legacy," South Coast Today, December 8, 2006; retrieved 2013-2-25. * Fairhaven, Massachusetts, US, since 1987 ==References== ==Other websites== * Tosashimizu City website * Category:Cities in Shikoku Category:Settlements in Kōchi Prefecture
title: Tosashimizu, Kōchi
